description:
Immunohistochemistry (IHC) is a method that combines biochemical, histological and immunological techniques into a simple but powerful assay for protein detection. IHC provides valuable information as it visualizes the distribution and localization of specific cellular components within cells and in proper tissue context.

 

This protocol describes the steps for performing ICC/IF.
keywords: ICC, IF, immunocytochemistry, immunofluorescence, FITC, light microscopy, fluorescent dye, cell imaging, immunohistochemistry, IHC, immunostaining
guidelines: Tissue preparation is a key to successful IHC experiments. Since no universal tissue preparation method will be ideal for all sample and tissue types, the protocol given here is intended as a starting point from which the experimenter must optimize as needed. All conditions should be standardized in order to ensure reproducible results. Keep in mind that you must be careful not to allow tissues to dry out at any time.
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working.

components.data: This fixation procedure using paraformaldehyde and formalin fixatives may cause autofluorescence in the green spectrum. In this case, you may try fluorophores in the (i) red range or (ii) infrared range if you have an infrared detection system.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: This fixation procedure using paraformaldehyde and formalin fixatives may cause autofluorescence in the green spectrum. In this case, you may try fluorophores in the (i) red range or (ii) infrared range if you have an infrared detection system.

components.data: Place settled coverslip in culture bottle or perforated plate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place settled coverslip in culture bottle or perforated plate.

components.data: Take out coverslip after cell growth has reached 60%.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Take out coverslip after cell growth has reached 60%.

components.data: Wash the coverslip 3X with PBS (AR0030, Boster Bio) to remove culture medium.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the coverslip 3X with PBS (AR0030, Boster Bio) to remove culture medium.

components.data: Immerse the coverslip (cells face up) in cold acetone or 4% paraformaldehyde (AR1068, Boster Bio) or neutral formalin for 10 to 20 minutes. Remember to close the lid to prevent evaporation.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Immerse the coverslip (cells face up) in cold acetone or 4% paraformaldehyde (AR1068, Boster Bio) or neutral formalin for 10 to 20 minutes. Remember to close the lid to prevent evaporation.
Wash the coverslip 3X with PBS.

components.data: Put the coverslip on filter paper (cells face up).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Put the coverslip on filter paper (cells face up).

components.data: Remove the liquid on the coverslip and allow it to dry for 8-10 hours.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the liquid on the coverslip and allow it to dry for 8-10 hours.

components.data: To thaw the slice, wash with neutral PBS at room temperature for 10-15 minutes (The cell climbing slice can be stored in gelatin at -20°C for one week).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: To thaw the slice, wash with neutral PBS at room temperature for 10-15 minutes (The cell climbing slice can be stored in gelatin at -20°C for one week).
Mix H2O2 with distilled water (v/v: 1:50).

components.data: Immerse frozen section or cell climbing slice in the diluted H2O2 at room temperature for 10 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Immerse frozen section or cell climbing slice in the diluted H2O2 at room temperature for 10 minutes.

components.data: Wash the section 3X distilled water (1 minute each).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the section 3X distilled water (1 minute each).

components.data: Antigen Retrieval (Proteolytic Induced Epitope Retrieval: PIER)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Antigen Retrieval (Proteolytic Induced Epitope Retrieval: PIER)

components.data: Dry the cell slices with filter paper.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dry the cell slices with filter paper.

components.data: Antigen Retrieval (Proteolytic Induced Epitope Retrieval: PIER)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Antigen Retrieval (Proteolytic Induced Epitope Retrieval: PIER)

components.data: Add compound digestion solution (AR0022, Boster Bio) (e.g. Trypsin solution or other enzymatic antigen retrieval solution) to the slices. We recommend the addition of 0.1% Triton to the samples before the digestion because this reduces surface tension and allows reagents to easily cover the entire sample.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add compound digestion solution (AR0022, Boster Bio) (e.g. Trypsin solution or other enzymatic antigen retrieval solution) to the slices. We recommend the addition of 0.1% Triton to the samples before the digestion because this reduces surface tension and allows reagents to easily cover the entire sample.

source_data.reagent_name: Antigen Retrieval Buffer (Enzymatic Digestion) For IHC

components.data: Antigen Retrieval (Proteolytic Induced Epitope Retrieval: PIER)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Antigen Retrieval (Proteolytic Induced Epitope Retrieval: PIER)

components.data: Incubate the slices at room temperature for 10 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the slices at room temperature for 10 minutes.

components.data: Antigen Retrieval (Proteolytic Induced Epitope Retrieval: PIER)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Antigen Retrieval (Proteolytic Induced Epitope Retrieval: PIER)

source_data.description: Wash with 3X PBS (10 minutes each).

components.data: Add 5% BSA blocking solution or normal goat serum to the PIER-treated samples.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 5% BSA blocking solution or normal goat serum to the PIER-treated samples.
Incubate the samples at 37°C for 30 minutes.

components.data: Shake off extra liquid and dry the samples with filter paper (No washing required).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Shake off extra liquid and dry the samples with filter paper (No washing required).

components.data: Dilute primary antibody with antibody diluent (AR1016, Boster Bio) to the concentration recommended by the antibody manufacturer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dilute primary antibody with antibody diluent (AR1016, Boster Bio) to the concentration recommended by the antibody manufacturer.

source_data.reagent_name: Antibody Dilution Buffer With BSA, Reducing Background

components.data: Add the diluted antibody (Recommended concentration: 0.4 µg to 2 µg) to the samples and incubate at 4°C overnight.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add the diluted antibody (Recommended concentration: 0.4 µg to 2 µg) to the samples and incubate at 4°C overnight.

components.data: Wash the samples 3X with PBS (15 minutes each).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the samples 3X with PBS (15 minutes each).

components.data: Dilute biotinylated secondary antibody with antibody diluent to the concentration recommended by the antibody manufacturer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dilute biotinylated secondary antibody with antibody diluent to the concentration recommended by the antibody manufacturer.

components.data: Add the diluted antibody to the samples and incubate at 37°C for 30 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add the diluted antibody to the samples and incubate at 37°C for 30 minutes.

components.data: Wash the samples 3X with PBS (8 minutes each).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the samples 3X with PBS (8 minutes each).

components.data: Add Strept-Avidin Biotin Complex – Fluorescence Iso-Thio-Cyanate (SABC-FITC) or Strept-Avidin Biotin Complex – Cyanine-3 (SABC-Cy3) reagents to the samples.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add Strept-Avidin Biotin Complex – Fluorescence Iso-Thio-Cyanate (SABC-FITC) or Strept-Avidin Biotin Complex – Cyanine-3 (SABC-Cy3) reagents to the samples.

components.data: Incubate the samples at 37°C for 30 minutes. Remember to avoid light.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the samples at 37°C for 30 minutes. Remember to avoid light.
Wash the samples 2X with PBS (Total 2 hours).

components.data: Seal the slices with water soluble sealing reagent (AR1018, Boster Bio).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Seal the slices with water soluble sealing reagent (AR1018, Boster Bio).

source_data.reagent_name: Aqueous Mounting Medium For IHC, ICC

components.data: Monitor the staining intensity under a fluorescence microscope.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Monitor the staining intensity under a fluorescence microscope.

components.data: Counterstain by adding DAPI staining solution (AR1176, AR1177, Boster Bio) to the sample.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Counterstain by adding DAPI staining solution (AR1176, AR1177, Boster Bio) to the sample.

components.data: Check the staining intensity again under a fluorescence microscope.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Check the staining intensity again under a fluorescence microscope.

components.data: For slide storage without significant decay in fluorescence signal, add 20 µL of anti-fade solution (AR1109, Boster Bio) to the sample followed by a cover glass. Avoid bubbles.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: For slide storage without significant decay in fluorescence signal, add 20 µL of anti-fade solution (AR1109, Boster Bio) to the sample followed by a cover glass. Avoid bubbles.
